channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Week: Hegseth’s Caribbean Campaign
item.description: Plus: Tom Stoppard, R.I.P.

item.title: Apple is experiencing its biggest leadership shakeup since Steve Jobs died
item.description: The exodus of top talent spans critical divisions from AI to design, legal affairs, environmental policy, and operations.

item.title: Immigration officers arrest Harvard professor who fired BB gun outside synagogue
item.description: Homeland Security said Thursday it had made an immigration arrest of a Harvard Law School professor who fired a BB gun outside a synagogue the day bef...

item.title: Trump national security blueprint declares ‘era of mass migration is over,' targets China’s rise
item.description: President Donald Trump unveiled a national security plan declaring the "era of mass migration is over" while targeting China as central threat.

item.title: Green Energy’s Problems Go Beyond Messaging
item.description: If well-funded environmentalists are losing the information war, maybe it’s time for them to look inward.

item.title: The Double Tap Isn’t the Issue
item.description: The debate should be about whether the ‘war on drugs’ is literal or not.

item.title: Formula One Title Fight Again Comes Down To Abu Dhabi
item.description: Sunday’s race marks not just the culmination of a compelling three-way title fight but the end of an era in Formula One broadcasting.

item.title: AI Data Centers Are Wreaking Havoc On Local Communities Across America
item.description: 'We are building these things so damn fast that by the time they are our online and activated, the problems are already built in.'

item.description: Republican state Rep. Kristin Robbins challenges Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz over fraud scandals, claiming billions in tax dollars were stolen during pand...

item.title: Around the world, refugees are shut out of the U.S. by Trump's new policies
item.description: When President Trump suspended the refugee program on day one of his current administration, thousands of people around the world who had been so clos...

item.title: Elon Musk and Bill Gates warn that AI will kill all jobs within 20 years. ‘That’s not what we’re seeing,’ LinkedIn exec says
item.description: Elon Musk may predict a jobless future, but LinkedIn’s latest hiring data shows demand rising, not collapsing. That will be music to Gen Z's ears.

item.title: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos credits a video store job for launching his career—and cherishes this lesson from Tony Bennett
item.description: "It was an MBA course and film school all wrapped up into one for me," he said.

item.title: If America Can’t Get Immigration Right, Nothing Else Matters

item.description: A federal judge put a stop to the State Department's plans to fire some employees, ruling late Thursday that the new stopgap spending law passed by Co...

item.title: The Laissez-Faire Sexism of Kill Bill Redux
item.description: How Tarantino inspired the race fantasies of wanton boys.

item.title: Trump Is Right on Gas-Powered Cars
item.description: The administration’s rollback is another sign that the climate panic is receding.

item.title: Mandela Barnes jumps into Wisconsin governor race — but baggage from his 2022 Senate bid follows
item.description: Former Wisconsin Lt. Gov. Mandela Barnes launched his campaign for governor as the likely Democratic primary frontrunner despite baggage from his 2022...

item.title: Confirming Covid Jabs Killed Kids Reinforces Gen Z’s Distrust Of Government
item.description: American teenagers have a fractured relationship with the federal government, one that may never be healed.

item.title: MacKenzie Scott is trying to close the DEI gap in higher ed, with $155 million in donations this week alone
item.description: These gifts are a “major source of encouragement” during uncertain times for higher education.

item.title: Raking In Hundreds Of Millions For Trafficking Kids Destroys U.S. Catholic Bishops’ Credibility On Immigration
item.description: In its special message, inaccurate wording disguises the USCCB’s self-interested opposition to the deportation of illegals.

item.description: Just days before Netflix emerged as the highest bidder, Paramount tore into the "myopic process" that had become "tainted."
